title: How Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's tactical tweaks kept Liverpool quiet but resulted in Manchester United's downfall
text:
It will take time for Ole Gunnar Solskjaer to assemble a team capable of challenging for the top four, let alone the title, but Manchester United did enough at Old Trafford on Sunday to secure a draw against the league leaders. Is this progress?

Jurgen Klopp was eager in the build-up to the game to convince his players it wouldn't be easy and what unfolded was far from the drubbing expected by many. However, for all the good Solskjaer did with his tactical set-up, individual errors and over-caution eventually proved his side's undoing over the 90 minutes.

Why Manchester United used a back three

Liverpool play through the middle of the pitch with width provided by full-backs so attack-minded they...
description: It will take time for Ole Gunnar Solskjaer to assemble a team capable of challenging for the top four, let alone the title, but Manchester United did enough at Old Trafford on Sunday to secure a draw against the league leaders.
